unnormalised: **Air Quality Deteriorates in Several Indian Cities Post-Onam Festivities**
normalised: **Air Quality Deteriorates in Several Indian Cities Post-Onam Festivities**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – Air quality across several Indian cities, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Kolkata, has deteriorated significantly following the conclusion of the Onam festival season. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) recorded an average Air Quality Index (AQI) of 350 in Delhi, categorizing it as "very poor."
normalised: New Delhi, twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three – Air quality across several Indian cities, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Kolkata, has deteriorated significantly following the conclusion of the Onam festival season. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) recorded an average Air Quality Index (A Q I) of three hundred and fifty in Delhi, categorizing it as "very poor."

unnormalised: Experts attribute the decline to a combination of factors, including increased vehicular traffic associated with festival travel, post-harvest stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana, and meteorological conditions hindering pollutant dispersion. Consumption of festive foods, particularly roadside preparations around biryani stalls, often contributes to localized emissions.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, Senior Scientist at the Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM), Pune, emphasized the need for stricter enforcement of environmental regulations. "We need immediate action to curb emissions from all sources to protect public health," he stated. The CPCB has issued advisories urging citizens to minimize outdoor activities and use public transport wherever possible. The Delhi government is considering re-implementing the odd-even rule for vehicles if the situation worsens further.
